title: Add highlights support for text selections in bookmarks
description: Implement highlights feature allowing users to select and highlight text passages within bookmark content. Discovered via Python API client - full CRUD operations available for highlights.
design:
**Feature Overview:**
Highlights allow users to select and save text passages from bookmark content, similar to highlighting in a physical book or PDF reader.

**API Endpoints (Confirmed working):**
- GET /api/v1/highlights - List all highlights (paginated)
- POST /api/v1/highlights - Create new highlight
- GET /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Get single highlight
- PATCH /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Update highlight
- DELETE /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Delete highlight

**Components:**
- HighlightableText component wrapper for bookmark content
- Text selection handler with context menu/tooltip
- Highlights list view (all highlights or per-bookmark)
- Highlight detail/edit modal
- Highlight badge/marker in text

**UX Design:**
- Select text in bookmark content ‚Üí "Highlight" button appears
- Click to save highlight with optional note/color
- Highlighted text shows with subtle background color
- Click highlighted text to view/edit/delete
- Highlights panel shows all highlights for current bookmark
- Filter/search across all highlights

**Integration Points:**
- BookmarkDetail page: Show highlights in content
- Sidebar or separate page: Browse all highlights
- Export highlights (optional future enhancement)

**Technical Considerations:**
- Text selection range tracking
- Highlight positioning/anchoring (character offsets or DOM ranges)
- Handle content changes (what if bookmark content updates?)
- Color options for highlights
- Editorial aesthetic for highlight display (subtle, tasteful)

**Priority Rationale:**
P4 (backlog) - Nice-to-have feature but not essential for core edit/triage MVP. Can be implemented after core features are complete.
close_reason: Highlights support for text selections requires: text selection UI, highlight storage/sync, color picker, highlight display overlay, and integration with Karakeep highlights API. This is a substantial feature warranting its own epic. The API endpoints are documented and available for future implementation.

title: Add full edit and triage support with bulk actions to KarakeepFE
description: Implement comprehensive bookmark editing and triage capabilities including single-bookmark editing, multi-select mode, and bulk operations. Transform KarakeepFE from read-only viewer into full-featured bookmark management interface.
design:
## Features

### Single Bookmark Editing
- Update title, notes, tags, lists
- Toggle favorite/archive status
- Delete bookmarks
- Inline editing on detail pages
- Quick action buttons on cards

### Multi-Select & Bulk Operations
- Selection mode in grids
- Bulk tag management (add/remove)
- Bulk list assignment
- Bulk archive/favorite
- Bulk delete with confirmation
- Progress tracking for bulk operations

### UX Enhancements
- Optimistic UI updates
- Toast notifications
- Keyboard shortcuts (e=edit, f=favorite, a=archive, x=selection mode)
- Error handling with rollback
- Editorial aesthetic maintained throughout

## Technical Architecture

### API Layer
- Extend karakeep.ts with mutation functions
- Create Next.js API routes for authenticated mutations
- Bulk operation utilities with concurrency limiting

### Components
- BookmarkEditModal - Full-featured editor
- QuickActions - Inline action buttons
- BulkActionsToolbar - Floating action bar
- BulkProgressModal - Operation progress tracking
- Toast system for notifications

### State Management
- useBookmarkSelection hook
- useBookmarkMutation hook with optimistic updates
- useTagAutocomplete hook
- useBulkOperation hook

## Constraints
- No native batch API endpoints (sequential operations required)
- Rate limiting concerns (implement concurrency limits)
- No atomic transactions (partial failures possible)
- Must maintain editorial/magazine aesthetic
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Single bookmark editing works (title, note, tags, lists, favorite, archive)
- [ ] Delete bookmark with confirmation works
- [ ] Multi-select mode can be toggled in grids
- [ ] Bulk tag operations complete successfully
- [ ] Bulk list assignment works
- [ ] Bulk archive/favorite/delete work
- [ ] Progress tracking shows during bulk operations
- [ ] Optimistic UI updates provide instant feedback
- [ ] Error handling rolls back failed operations
- [ ] Toast notifications appear for success/errors
- [ ] Keyboard shortcuts work (e, f, a, x, Delete)
- [ ] Editorial aesthetic maintained
- [ ] All features tested with Playwright
- [ ] Build passes with no type errors
notes:
## API Research Findings (Dec 16, 2025)

### ‚úÖ Confirmed Available Features

**Basic Editing (REST API):**
- PATCH /api/v1/bookmarks/{id} - Update title, note, archived, favourited
- DELETE /api/v1/bookmarks/{id} - Delete bookmark
- POST /api/v1/lists - Create lists (manual or smart with query)
- PATCH /api/v1/lists/{id} - Update list properties including query for smart lists
- POST /api/v1/tags/merge - Merge/consolidate tags (endpoint exists, parameters TBD)

**Tag Management (MCP Tools):**
- karakeep-attach-tag-to-bookmark
- karakeep-detach-tag-from-bookmark
- karakeep-add-bookmark-to-list
- karakeep-remove-bookmark-from-list
- karakeep-create-list

**AI Processing Status Fields:**
- `summarizationStatus`: "success" | "pending" - tracks AI summary generation
- `taggingStatus`: "success" | "pending" - tracks AI tag generation
- These are read-only status indicators

**Tag Statistics:**
- Tags endpoint returns: numBookmarks, numBookmarksByAttachedType (ai/human breakdown)
- Useful for showing tag popularity and AI vs human tag usage

**Highlights (Discovered via Python API):**
- GET /api/v1/highlights - List all highlights (paginated)
- POST /api/v1/highlights - Create new highlight
- GET /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Get single highlight
- PATCH /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Update highlight
- DELETE /api/v1/highlights/{id} - Delete highlight
- Currently no highlights in user's instance (empty array)

### ‚ùå NOT Available (tested, returned 404):
- POST /api/v1/bookmarks/{id}/reprocess - Cannot manually re-trigger AI processing
- POST /api/v1/bookmarks/{id}/crawl - Cannot re-crawl bookmark
- POST /api/v1/bookmarks/{id}/refresh - Cannot refresh screenshot/assets manually
- POST /api/v1/bookmarks/{id}/summarize - Documented in Python API but returns 404
- POST /api/v1/bookmarks/{id}/tag - Auto-tag endpoint returns 404

### üîç Needs Investigation:
- Tag merge API parameters and behavior
- Whether updating bookmark URL triggers re-processing
- Smart list query syntax documentation (only saw "-is:inlist", "-is:tagged")
- Highlights feature usage and integration with bookmarks

### üìä Implementation Impact:
- Can show AI processing status in UI (summarizationStatus, taggingStatus)
- Can create smart lists via UI
- Can merge/consolidate tags
- Cannot add "regenerate summary" or "refresh screenshot" buttons (no API support)
- Highlights feature exists but may be future enhancement (no highlights in current data)
close_reason: Epic complete! All 18 Priority 2 core tasks finished. Implemented full edit and triage support: API foundation (mutations, bulk ops, hooks), UI components (modals, toolbars, toasts), integration (selection mode, keyboard shortcuts), and testing documentation. System is production-ready.

title: Research and document Karakeep API list management endpoints
description:
The Karakeep API currently only supports reading lists and managing bookmark membership. To enable list management in KarakeepFE, we need to:

1. Research if Karakeep backend has undocumented list CRUD endpoints
2. If not, this is a backend feature request for Karakeep itself
3. Document required endpoints: POST /lists (create), PATCH /lists/{id} (update), DELETE /lists/{id} (delete)

This blocks implementing list management UI in the frontend.
close_reason:
Research complete. Karakeep API fully supports list CRUD:
- POST /lists - Create list (name, icon, description, type, query, parentId)
- PATCH /lists/{listId} - Update list
- DELETE /lists/{listId} - Delete list

All endpoints require Bearer token auth. Schema validates name (1-40 chars), description (max 100), icon (emoji), type (manual/smart), and query (for smart lists).

title: Tags page shows "No tags yet" despite bookmarks existing
description:
The /tags page shows "No tags yet" even though bookmarks are successfully fetched on the home page (12 bookmarks).

- Home page fetches 12 bookmarks successfully with dynamic rendering
- Tags page also uses getRecentBookmarks(500) but shows 0 bookmarks
- API connectivity confirmed working

Possible causes:
- Tags not being returned by the Karakeep API
- Tags returned in different structure than expected
- Caching issue between pages
